name: Architectural Engineering
mathRequirements: Differential Calculus, Integral Calculus, Vector Calculus I, Applied Differential Equations, Introduction to Matrix Algebra, Introduction to Series
description: Architectural engineering is the application of engineering fundamentals to the design of buildings and building systems.                   In the architectural engineering program, you'll have the chance to learn how to design buildings that are not only visually stunning but also safe, energy-efficient, and supportive of the health and well-being of those who occupy them. You'll gain a deep understanding of electrical, lighting, mechanical, and structural system and learn how building systems interact with each other. With a focus on sustainability and high-performance buildings, you'll be at the forefront of shaping the built environment for a better future. Upon graduation, you'll have highly sought-after skills and the ability to collaborate with architects, urban planners, and civil engineers to bring your visions to life.                   Students in Oregon State’s program — the only one in the Pacific Northwest — can concentrate on chosen architectural engineering sub-disciplines, such as lighting, mechanical systems, and structures. Graduates possess highly marketable skills that enable them to engineer sustainable and high-performance buildings that support the health of people and the planet.
citation: Architectural Engineering. (2023, July 7). Oregon State University College of Engineering. https://engineering.oregonstate.edu/Academics/Degrees/architectural-engineering, https://engineering.oregonstate.edu/about/fact-sheet/enrollment-summary-2022#enroll-sum

careers: Architectural Engineer, Building Systems Engineer, Construction Engineer, Design Engineer, Energy Engineer, Facilities Engineer, HVAC Engineer, Lighting Designer, Mechanical Engineer, Structural Engineer, Sustainable Design Engineer, Urban Planner
hardestClasses: Building Systems Design, Construction Engineering, Energy Systems, Environmental Systems, HVAC Systems, Lighting Systems, Structural Systems
skillMatch: Attention to Detail, Creative, Analytical, Problem-solver, Team Player

name: Bioengineering
mathRequirements: Differential Calculus, Integral Calculus, Vector Calculus I
description: Make a difference to human health by studying bioengineering. In this interdisciplinary field, you'll combine biology and engineering to create new materials, devices, and processes for medical applications and biotech industries. You'll learn from leading experts in the field and have opportunities to discover applications in precision health, medical device development, cancer treatment, and more. With a solid foundation in biology, chemistry, physics, and math, underpinning advanced coursework in bioengineering principles, you'll be prepared for a career at the nexus of living systems and human design. Students in the bioengineering program at Oregon State University gain a solid background in biology, chemistry, physics and math, in addition to core engineering studies and research opportunities. Advanced coursework includes biomedical engineering principles, materials engineering, and product design. All students complete a capstone-design experience that integrates drug and medical device regulation. Our diverse faculty pursue research interests with applications in precision health, medical device development, cancer treatment, immunotherapy, drug discovery, biomaterials, cell/tissue preservation, and epidemiology.
citation: Bioengineering. (2023, July 7). Oregon State University College of Engineering. https://engineering.oregonstate.edu/Academics/Degrees/bioengineering, https://engineering.oregonstate.edu/about/fact-sheet/enrollment-summary-2022#enroll-sum
clubs: Biomedical Engineering Society Student Chapter, Chemical, Biological, and Environmental Engineering Student Association, Engineers Without Borders OSU Chapter
careers: Biomedical Engineer, Biotechnology Engineer, Clinical Engineer, Drug Development Engineer, Medical Device Engineer, Pharmaceutical Engineer, Product Development Engineer, Quality Engineer, Regulatory Affairs Specialist, Research Scientist, Tissue Engineer
hardestClasses: Biomechanics, Biomaterials, Biomedical Instrumentation, Biomedical Imaging, Biomedical Signal Processing, Cell and Tissue Engineering, Drug Delivery, Medical Device Design, Medical Imaging, Medical Product Regulation, Molecular and Cellular Bioengineering, Nanomedicine, Neural Engineering, Orthopedic Biomechanics, Tissue Engineering
skillMatch: Innovative thinking, Detail Oriented, Interdisciplinary Collaboration, Ethical Judgment, Adaptability

name: Chemical Enginering
mathRequirements: Differential Calculus, Integral Calculus, Vector Calculus I
description: Chemical engineering is the application of engineering principles to the design, analysis, and operation of processes that transform raw materials into useful products. In the chemical engineering program at Oregon State University, you'll learn how to design and operate processes that are safe, sustainable, and economically viable. You'll gain a deep understanding of chemical processes, thermodynamics, transport phenomena, and reaction engineering. You'll also learn how to design and operate chemical reactors, separation processes, and process control systems. With a focus on sustainability and renewable energy, you'll be at the forefront of shaping the future of chemical processes. Upon graduation, you'll have highly sought-after skills and the ability to work in a wide range of industries, including energy, chemicals, pharmaceuticals, and environmental engineering. Students in Oregon State’s program can concentrate on chosen chemical engineering sub-disciplines, such as biotechnology, environmental engineering, and process systems engineering. Graduates possess highly marketable skills that enable them to engineer sustainable and efficient processes that support the health of people and the planet.
citation: Chemical Engineering. (2023, July 7). Oregon State University College of Engineering. https://engineering.oregonstate.edu/Academics/Degrees/chemical-engineering, https://engineering.oregonstate.edu/about/fact-sheet/enrollment-summary-2022#enroll-sum

hardestClasses: Thermodynamics, Transport Phenomena, Chemical Reaction Engineering, Process Control, Process Design, Process Safety, Process Systems Engineering
skillMatch: Analytical skills, Critical thinking, Safety consciousness, Patience and perseverance, Environmental awareness

name: Civil Engineering
mathRequirements: Differential Calculus, Integral Calculus, Vector Calculus I
description: Civil engineering is the application of engineering principles to the design, analysis, and construction of infrastructure systems. In the civil engineering program at Oregon State University, you'll learn how to design and build structures, transportation systems, and water resources that are safe, sustainable, and economically viable. You'll gain a deep understanding of structural engineering, transportation engineering, and water resources engineering. You'll also learn how to design and build bridges, buildings, highways, and water treatment plants. With a focus on sustainability and resilience, you'll be at the forefront of shaping the future of infrastructure systems. Upon graduation, you'll have highly sought-after skills and the ability to work in a wide range of industries, including construction, transportation, and environmental engineering. Students in Oregon State’s program can concentrate on chosen civil engineering sub-disciplines, such as environmental engineering, geotechnical engineering, and structural engineering. Graduates possess highly marketable skills that enable them to engineer sustainable and resilient infrastructure systems that support the health of people and the planet.

name: Computer Science

mathRequirements: Differential Calculus, Integral Calculus, Elements of Discrete Mathematics
description: Computer science is the study of algorithms, data structures, and programming languages. In the computer science program at Oregon State University, you'll learn how to design and analyze algorithms, develop software systems, and understand the theory behind computation. You'll gain a deep understanding of computer systems, software engineering, and artificial intelligence. You'll also learn how to develop and deploy software applications, and how to design and analyze algorithms. With a focus on security and privacy, you'll be at the forefront of shaping the future of computing. Upon graduation, you'll have highly sought-after skills and the ability to work in a wide range of industries, including technology, finance, and healthcare. Students in Oregon State’s program can concentrate on chosen computer science sub-disciplines, such as cybersecurity, data science, and machine learning. Graduates possess highly marketable skills that enable them to engineer secure and reliable software systems that support the health of people and the planet.

name: Nuclear Engineering
mathRequirements: Differential Calculus, Integral Calculus, Vector Calculus I, Applied Differential Equations, Introduction to Matrix Algebra, Introduction to Series
description: Nuclear engineering focuses on understanding and using nuclear power to provide carbon-free electricity and to produce and use radiation and radioactive materials. Nuclear engineers research and develop new reactor and radiation shielding designs, advanced computational techniques, nuclear fuel recycling and management strategies, and radioisotope technologies for use in research, medicine, industry, and national security. At Oregon State, students experience nuclear engineering like nowhere else in the world. Our on-site nuclear reactor and large-scale test facilities, renowned faculty, and low student-to-faculty ratio combine to make a unique and rewarding experience at one of the nation’s highest ranked programs.
citation: Nuclear Engineering. (2023, July 7). Oregon State University College of Engineering. https://engineering.oregonstate.edu/Academics/Degrees/nuclear-engineering, https://engineering.oregonstate.edu/about/fact-sheet/enrollment-summary-2022#enroll-sum

name: Outdoor Products
description: The Bachelor of Science in Outdoor Products program at Oregon State University-Cascades is one of only a few of its kind in the country. This creative and interdisciplinary program prepares students for a career in the outdoor industry. Leaders in the industry are constantly looking to hire innovative thinkers who also champion responsible approaches to product commercialization and who understand the need to balance business with respect for the natural world. Students learn the historical context of the outdoor industry, so they can help shape its future. They’ll study design, engineering, natural resources, outdoor recreation, sustainability, and business with expert faculty who have experience in research, industry, and public agencies, and who believe in environmental stewardship and corporate responsibility. Practicums, internships, and capstone projects are integral to the core curriculum and provide students with practical, hands-on experiences that potential employers value. Students majoring in other programs at OSU-Cascades can choose to complete the outdoor products minor.
citation: Outdoor Products. (2023, July 7). Oregon State University College of Engineering. https://engineering.oregonstate.edu/Academics/Degrees/outdoor-products, https://engineering.oregonstate.edu/about/fact-sheet/enrollment-summary-2022#enroll-sum

name: Radiation Health Physics
campus: Offered at the Corvallis Campus and Ecampus
mathRequirements: Differential Calculus, Integral Calculus, Vector Calculus I
description: Radiation health physics involves the study of ionizing radiation and developing systems and methods to protect people and their environments from radiations hazards. Radiation health physicists protect us from the potential dangers of exposure to radiation. Their responsibilities may include managing radiation safety at nuclear plants and hospitals; designing radiation shields for industrial and medical applications; designing sophisticated radiation detection systems; researching the effects of radiation on the environment; and providing radiation protection training. Their role is essential to society’s well-being. Students at Oregon State are guided by our top-notch faculty, who are known worldwide for their research, expertise, and innovative teaching. Our program, which traces its roots back to the 1960s, now graduates more students than any other academic institution in the nation, putting them on track to be leaders in this dynamic, indispensable field.
citation: Radiation Health Physics. (2023, July 7). Oregon State University College of Engineering. https://engineering.oregonstate.edu/Academics/Degrees/radiation-health-physics, https://engineering.oregonstate.edu/about/fact-sheet/enrollment-summary-2022#enroll-sum

hardestClasses: Radiation Safety, Radiation Shielding, Radiation Detection, Radiation Effects, Radiation Protection
skillMatch: Analytical Skills, Attention to Detail, Safety Consciousness, Problem-Solving Ability, Technical Proficiency
